intro: Chaetanthera collina, commonly known as the mountain honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of North America. It is a member of the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or yellow in color, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Chaetanthera collina thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native plants for ecological gardens.
